intro: Ageratina guatemalensis, commonly known as Guatemalan blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that are arranged in dense clusters, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Ageratina guatemalensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
